node.title: Kids killed every year by tip-over TVs. Easy fix costs $20.
node.description: More than 22,000 people a year end up in the ER for injuries from televisions and furniture falling on them.

node.title: U.S.-born Eileen Gu wins Olympic skiing gold representing China
node.description: The 18-year-old stunned Tess Ledeux of France to win the Olympic debut of women's freeski big air, at the Beijing Games.

node.title: The Moral Quandary of ‘Slow Fashion’ Influencers
node.description: Is it possible to preach the values of sustainability while still promoting consumption?

node.title: 'We do have some control over what happens next' with Omicron - PM
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says today is the start of a nationwide booster drive, with an extra 1 million New Zealanders being urged to get their third shot.

node.title: Bill to ban conversion therapy passes second reading
node.description: A bill that would ban conversion therapy has passed its second reading in Parliament.

node.title: Bruce Willis gets own category for Razzie Awards
node.description: Diana, the film version of a musical about the late Princess of Wales, received a field-leading nine Razzie Award nominations, while Bruce Willis was skewered with his own category of acting…

node.title: PM says closing schools will be last resort, as 24 are connected to cases
node.description: At least 24 schools and early learning centres have connections to Covid-19 cases, but the prime minister says schools will only be closed as a last resort.

node.title: Different Omicron outbreak models helpful for guiding responses  - Hendy
node.description: A modeller says people's actions are changing the trajectory of Omicron case numbers, but models of different scenarios help guide decision-making. Audio

node.title: Lab workers 'operating on the edge' if test demand increases
node.description: Lab workers are warning that "the worried well" are among those needing a targeted message from health leaders to avoid clogging up the nation's labs once Omicron spreads. Audio

node.title: Homeless man missing for four years ruled dead by coroner
node.description: A homeless man who has been missing in Nelson for more than four years has been ruled dead by the coroner.

node.title: Leaders exchange barbs in opening speeches to Parliament
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and Opposition leader Chris Luxon have launched stinging attacks on their opponents in their opening speeches to Parliament this year. Video

node.title: Protesters opposed to Covid-19 measures remain in Parliament's grounds for hours
node.description: The usually busy roads around Parliament looked more like a campground as dozens of vans and motorhomes blocked the thoroughfare for most of today.

node.title: AFLW live: Struggling Saints and Eagles hunt for first wins of the season
node.description: One of St Kilda or West Coast will break their 2022 ducks as they meet for Tuesday night footy. Follow our live AFLW ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

node.title: 'Everyone was so, so happy': Dolphin rescued from shallow mud in Port Phillip Bay
node.description: Police used two inflatable rescue boats to help the animal, which became stranded in shallow water and mud at Williamstown on Monday afternoon.

node.title: Khawaja calls on Cummins, Finch to end speculation on Langer revolt
node.description: Usman Khawaja says only Test and ODI captains Pat Cummins and Aaron Finch can end the rumours of a player revolt that led to Justin Langer's resignation.

node.title: How organisers turned an industrial wasteland into one of the most iconic venues at the Winter Olympics
node.description: Shougang used to be home to a steel mill, spewing noxious gas into the Beijing air for decades. Now it is a case study in urban renewal as home to one of Beijing 2022's most iconic venues.

node.title: Trauma cleaning business apologises for graphic social media posts
node.description: A trauma cleaning business that has been posting graphic death-related images on social media has apologised.

node.title: Luxon calls for Auckland fuel tax to be scrapped as prices rise
node.description: The National Party is calling for the regional fuel tax in Auckland to be scrapped to give motorists some relief in the face of skyrocketing prices.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 202 new community cases today, 63 in MIQ
node.description: There are 202 new community cases of Covid-19 being reported today.

node.title: A Former Bengal’s Super Bowl Injury Taught Him How to Fight Football’s Other Ravages
node.description: Tim Krumrie’s devastating leg injury marked the Cincinnati Bengals’ last Super Bowl appearance. Still, he says he has no regrets for it or the brain trauma that he thinks football gave him.

node.title: Te Pāti Māori calls for removal of UK royals as head of state
node.description: Te Pāti Māori have launched a petition calling for constitutional change, including removing the British royal family as head of state.

node.title: Between 460 and 1450 people will die of Omicron - latest modelling
node.description: Modellers are predicting between 460 and 1450 people will die from Covid-19 in the Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Potato milk hits UK supermarket shelves
node.description: Described as "deliciously creamy" and the "perfect foam" for your cuppa, potato milk is the latest contender to the plant milk market. Audio

node.title: Contact Energy's planned power station to cost $140m more
node.description: Contact Energy's new Tauhara geothermal power station will be delayed slightly, will cost more, but is expected to generate more power.

node.title: Taranaki business loses $70,000 to fake shipping company
node.description: Police are warning businesses to be wary of scams after a Taranaki firm lost almost $70,000 to a false company overseas.

node.title: Rio Tinto says it wants to delay closure of Tiwai Point smelter
node.description: Rio Tinto says it believes there is a long-term future for the Bluff operation past its previously signalled closure date in 2024.

node.title: 'Robo-advice' a low-cost option for financial planning
node.description: Only two firms offer low-cost computer-generated financial advice, despite it being available for four years.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - Disappointing outing for Robinson, Aces sneak home over Northern and sponsors drops Greenwood.

node.title: Innovation necessary for sustainable financial future - Reserve Bank governor
node.description: Reserve Bank Governor Adrian Orr says the future of money and cash is at a "crossroad" and innovation is necessary to build a sustainable future.

node.title: California to roll back mask mandate after current rules expire next week
node.description: Everyone — vaccinated or not — will have to continue wearing masks in higher-risk areas like public transit and nursing homes.
